title: Introduction
description: JavaScript is a programming language used to make web pages interactive. It runs in the browser and allows you to respond to user actions.
hints: Your code should run without errors.

title: Console Output
description: In JavaScript, the console.log() method tells the web console to output a message. We are going to use this a lot. The message we want to display should be inside parentheses ( ) and surrounded by quotes. They can be double quotes  or single quotes, but the opening and closing quote marks have to match
task: Use console.log() to print 'Hello World!' to the console.
hints: Put your message inside the parentheses.
Remember to wrap text in quotes.

title: Variables
description: a variable is a name given to a memory location. It is the basic unit of storage in a program. The value stored in a variable can be accessed or changed during program execution.
task: Create a variable named 'heroName' and assign it the value 'Jet', then print it to the console.
hints: Use let or const to create a variable.

title: Data Types
description: In a programmer‚Äôs adventure, a variable is like a chest, and the data type is the magic that controls it. It decides what kind of treasure can be stored inside and how much space the chest has. Choosing the right data type keeps your journey safe and your program strong
task: Create a variable 'age' with the number 18 and a variable 'isStudent' with the boolean value true, then print both to the console.

title: Function Basics
description: Learn how to define and call functions in JavaScript. A function can be created with the function keyword, a name, and parentheses.
task: Define a function named 'greet' that prints 'Hello!' to the console, then call the function.
hints: Call the function after defining it.

title: Parameters & Arguments
description: Pass information into functions using parameters and arguments. Parameters are listed inside the parentheses in the function definition and Arguments are the real values passed to, and received by the function
task: Define a function 'greet' that takes a parameter 'name' and prints 'Hello ' followed by the name. Call the function with the argument 'Jet'.
hints: Define a parameter in the function.

title: Return Values
description: Return values are just what they sound like ‚Äî the values that a function returns when it completes. Functions can return values using the return statement.
task: Define a function 'add' that takes two parameters and returns their sum. Call the function with arguments 2 and 3, then print the result to the console.

title: Arrow Functions
description: Did you know that Arrow Functions were introduced in ES6 and are commonly used in modern Javascript. A shorter syntax for writing functions using arrow functions.
task: Rewrite the 'greet' function using arrow function syntax that takes a parameter 'name' and prints 'Hello ' followed by the name. Call the function with the argument 'Jet'.
lessonExample:
const greet = name => console.log("Hello " + name);
greet("Jet");
hints: Call the function with a value.

title: Arrays
description: The Array object, as with arrays in other programming languages, enables storing a collection of multiple items under a single variable name, and has members for performing common array operations. JavaScript arrays are resizable and can contain a mix of different data types, Can store multiple values in an array.
task: Create an array 'fruits' containing 'Apple' and 'Banana', then print the first item to the console.
hints: Use square brackets [] to define an array.

title: Array Methods
description: Did you know that ES2022 introduced the array method at()?. Learn to manipulate arrays using push(), pop(), and other methods
task: Create an array and add numbers 1, 2, and 3 using push(), then print the array to the console.
hints: Use pop() to remove the last item.

title: Objects
description: Store data using key-value pairs. Objects can describe anything like houses, cars, people, animals, or any other subjects. An Object is a variable that can hold many variables
task: Create an object 'person' with properties 'name' set to 'Jet' and 'age' set to 18, then print the name property to the console.

title: Object Methods
description: Object methods are actions that can be performed on objects. Objects can have methods (functions) as properties.
task: Create an object 'person' with a method 'greet' that prints 'Hi' to the console, then call the greet method.
hints: Define a function inside an object.

title: Selecting Elements
description: Learn how to select HTML elements using document.querySelector or getElementById.
task: Select the <h1> element and print its text content to the console.

title: Modifying Content
description: Change the content of HTML elements using JavaScript.
task: Change the text of the <h1> element to 'Hi!'.

title: Event Listeners
description: Respond to user actions by adding event listeners.
task: Add a click event listener to a button that prints 'Clicked!' to the console when clicked.
hints: Use an arrow function to define the callback.

title: Dynamic Styling
description: Change the style of HTML elements dynamically using JavaScript.
task: Change the color of the <h1> element to red.

title: JavaScript Exam
description: Test your JavaScript knowledge by solving exercises covering all previous modules.
hints: Use functions, variables, arrays, objects, and DOM manipulation.
